metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4322 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache Tomcat before 6.0.39, 7.x before 7.0.50, and 8.x before 8.0.0-RC10 processes chunked transfer coding without properly handling (1) a large total amount of chunked data or (2) whitespace characters in an HTTP header value within a trailer field, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service by streaming data.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-3544.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1').
tomcat7 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1').
